stories.text:
I’ve been reading about image processing and I’d like to write a JPEG encoder. But I’m stuck figuring out something, where do I get source image data and table specifications?

My question comes from page 13 (17 in pdf reader) https://www.w3.org/Graphics/JPEG/itu-t81.pdf
stories.title: Ask HN: How to acquire raw image data for JPEG encoding
How about a Genius Basic Income?
1400 sensor rural air quality network for 300M people in India
A Look Back at the USSR Computer Industry

stories.text:
After a few years playing with VPSs, I find alluring the offers coming from Hetzner/OVH and similars.

I am worried about the new responsibilities that might come with it such as checking Disks and RAMs.

Those of you with experience: What maintenance do you do? What's been your experience?
stories.title: Ask HN: What maintenance should a dedicated server have?

stories.text:
I have a few 256 px x 256 px images. I need to enlarge them as much as possible while minimizing distortion. I'd like to turn them into a wall poster.

Do you have any advise on what to do to get the best result?

I've tried to directly enlarge them with photoshop but the details gets lost and they look terrible.

Is there a better way to do it?
stories.title: Ask HN: What's the best way to up-scale an image?
